headline: Amazon, Cameco, Universal Health Services: Trending Tickers
summary: Amazon (AMZN) is investing $20 billion in Pennsylvania data centers as Big Tech companies work to expand artificial intelligence (AI) infrastructure. Cameco (CCJ) stock surges after Westinghouse Electric Corporation, a company of which Cameco owns a significant portion, increased its EBITDA outlook for the next year and signed a nuclear deal. Universal Health Services (UHS) stock is falling after the company's CFO, Steve Filton, said that patients are spending longer in the hospital than they did pre-COVID. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

headline: Hospital Stocks Tanked Early Monday. Budget Bill Has Wall Street on Edge.
summary: The selloff, based on the faintest whisps of news about the fate of the budget negotiations, shows just how anxious the bill has left investors.

headline: Why Universal Health Services (UHS) Shares Are Trading Lower Today
summary: Shares of hospital management company Universal Health Services (NYSE:UHS) fell 5.7% in the afternoon session after Chief Financial Officer Steve Filton noted during a recent conference that procedural volumes (an important driver of hospital revenue) "have been slower to recover back to historical levels than we might have imagined."

headline: IBM all-time high, Universal Health falls, Topgolf Callaway rises
summary: Market Domination co-host Yahoo Finance host Julie Hyman tracks today's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute. IBM (IBM) stock hit an all-time high and surpassed a $250 billion market cap. Universal Health Services (UHS) stock is under pressure after the company presented at the Goldman Sachs Global Healthcare Conference. Topgolf Callaway (MODG) stock is surging after a board member purchased $2.5 million in shares last week. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Hospital Stocks Fall After New Trump Directive on Medicaid
summary: Shares of Universal Health Services and other large U.S. hospital chains fell sharply Monday.  The moves appeared to be in response to a directive Friday by President Trump telling the government to scrutinize Medicaid payments more closely.  Trump in his memo told the Department of Health and Human Services to “take appropriate action to eliminate waste, fraud, and abuse in Medicaid, including by ensuring Medicaid payments rates are not higher than Medicare, to the extent permitted by applicable law.”

raw.headline: Hospital Stocks Fall After New Trump Directive on Medicaid

headline: Universal Health Services Stock Sinks as CFO Says Post-Covid Care Recovery Has Slowed
summary: Shares of Universal Health Services sank on Monday after the hospital operator's CFO made comments at an industry conference about the company's outlook for volume of care it provides.
